headline: The Haunting of Kurtz
description: A layered personal and literary meditation on Joseph Conrad's Heart of Darkness. The essay explores the philosophical dimensions of colonialism, sanity, identity, and recursive narration, with Kurtz as a metaphysical absence at the story’s center.
whyItMatters: Because the post uses literature to collapse the boundary between narrative and identity, exploring how the echo of a voice like Kurtz's haunts both colonial critique and personal reflection.
articleExcerpt: Heart of Darkness is a masterpiece. It is layered, expressive – a work of insanity. A work of brilliance so profound it stirred the part of my soul that leaps when a little corner of existential mystery is explored.
sourceFragments: To source or cite when discussing Heart of Darkness would be to defeat the purpose of the novel.
Kurtz, who is ultimately closest to the center of the story, is more a space than a character.
I accept the consequences of my actions. I knowingly break the rules.
